author: Yahoo
title: Former All Black Ali Williams charged after cocaine bust - Yahoo New Zealand

organizations.name: yahoo new zealand share former all black

text:
Share Former All Black Ali Williams charged after cocaine bust - Yahoo New Zealand French police have charged former All Black Ali Williams with buying cocaine and Australian international James O'Connor with possession of the drug, police sources said. Close Ali Williams: Life after rugby UP NEXT VIDEO Ali Williams: Life after rugby. Source: Societe Generale/YouTube Ali Williams: Life after rugby 
The pair, who play in France's Top 14 league, were arrested on Saturday night outside a nightclub near the Champs Elysees and found to be in possession of 2.4 grams (0.08 ounces) of the substance. 
They were released from custody on Sunday evening, with Williams, 35, due to appear in court at a later date. 
O'Connor faces a fine on the lesser charge of possession, Paris police sources said. It is alleged Williams tried to purchase €200 (NZ$293) worth of cocaine. Photo: Getty 
At the time of arrest, Williams allegedly attempted to throw three packets of cocaine on the ground, which were immediately picked up by investigators, LBI reported. 
In a statement, Racing 92 said Williams has been suspended as a precautionary measure. 
"If the investigation confirms (Williams') possession of cocaine and the transaction, it would not only be a crime under the law but also a serious mistake in view of our ethics," said the club, while adding that Williams deserved the presumption of innocence. Communiqué de presse du Racing 92 - https://t.co/uMt47qslRO pic.twitter.com/Gw9EXlp4vD — Racing 92 (@racing92) February 25, 2017 
Williams played for the All Blacks 77 times in his decade-long international career, which ended in 2012. 
The arrest comes just two weeks after former All Black Dan Carter was caught drink driving in Paris. 
O'Connor, 26, who plays on the wing or at fullback for Top 14 rivals Toulon, appeared 44 times for Australia between 2008 and 2013. He made his debut at 18, the second youngest Wallaby in Australian rugby history. 
– With AFP
